Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Mirva H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here alone in March 2012. My expectations were really low due to reviews. There were lots of complaints about crappy, tiny rooms with small or no windows at all and unfriendly staff. I wondered if I had come to a different hotel.. I payed about 20-30 euros per night, and I think I got really acceptable value for the money. The reception, breakfast room and my room were neat. They gave me a double room, although I was traveling alone. It was more spacious than e.g. Finnish double rooms tend to be. Ok, there were some moldy spots on the roof of the bathroom, but they didn't bother me as otherwise I was happy with the room, and I didn't stay very long. There were also a pretty painting and beautifully framed, big mirror in the room. The view was to the backyard. Soundproof was pretty bad, that was a bit of a problem as the room was in the ground floor. They cleaned every day, brought clean towels etc. The staff were really friendly, young and perky. They didn't allow my friend to come to the room, but the reason was very understandable. Otherwise they were hospitable, my friend got to use the Internet and so on. Breakfast was okay, similar stuff I'd have at home. The breakfast room was peaceful, not very many other guests there. I was surprised that there were so many elder people at that time. (My friend stayed in another hotel and it was full of very young people.) Location is good, the area looks very wealthy and neat. Museums and shopping streets are close. For a budget meal we had to walk a bit further. I felt safe when I walked back to the hotel at night. The bus to the airport stops nearby, next to the Rijksmuseum :).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: t_w_s_d
Reviews.Content: I thought for the amount of money I paid for this room (granted, it was a busy time of year) I would get more than a tiny closet in the basement of the building. Not even a window to look out of. Breakfast not included in the price of the room either. Staff were okay. The room itself was clean-ish and warm. Appreciated the many options of English TV.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great value and lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: charley1990 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really close to the city centre, easy walking distance. Rooms really nice and staff very helpful and friendly! Would definitively stay here again! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: naz s
Reviews.Content: this is the worst hotel i have ever stayed in .stayed 3 nights. even though i was one person booked a single room and was on budget room. the money paid did not justify the room.the property was run down.even the hotel sign was in a run down state.was given a boxed room in a basement.the room was claustrophobic. the walls were damp. the bed was about only 2 feet wide. so if you are a large person no way.the window was not sound proof. could her people talikng and walking along the foot path.in the first night heard thumping noise for about one hour.then it stopped.second night heard banging /thumping noise for bout about 4 hours. assumed the noise was coming from adjacent building(building works)had rough nite and was unable to sleep. on third the banging went on all night. could not sleep. went to, reception desk and made a compliant asked what the banging noise was. I WAS TOLD IT WAS THE HEATER BOILER.was offered an another room at 3 o clock in the morning. i was due to check in the morning. the hotel is not near the city center as it clims. its about 30 mins walk to dam square. give this hotel a wide berth. i do not recommend this hotel and also its overpriced. hope this helps fellow travellers

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Kessy M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend have stayed for 3 nights in twin room of Quentin England Hotel. Although we knew that for money we paid for the room we couldn't expect much, but room was really much smaller than we expected and sleep quality wasn't good due to noises from outside and from neighbors. Other than that, the room was pretty clean, friendly staff was always ready to help and location is not that bad either, just few minutes walk to public transport.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay overall...”
Reviews.Author: Anna Katharina W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quentin England for 3 nights in March. The location is great. Not in the middle of the nightlife, yet close to the Leidseplein and right next to Vondelpark. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was small but clean and with a nice view. Not overpriced and a decent breakfast. I would stay there again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain and won't complain.”
Reviews.Author: lindawoods94
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days in room 26 on the ground floor....nothing bothered me in the hotel whatsoever as u know u get what u pay for so â‚¬128 for 2 people for 2 nights was brilliant. After reading some reviews I was going to cancel but I'm now glad I didn't . The staff were helpful and pleasant and it close to the square which was buzzing. If u get lost while trying to find it it's facing the casino and down the street of Qpark car park, turn left at the outdoor swimming pool (seriously) lol I found that strange although it is only 2 feet deep wif no water in it. So go ahead and book il defo go bk to the quentin England

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all you read!”
Reviews.Author: Mandyblackburn64
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel before reading the reviews on tripadvisor, so were a little apprehensive with what we would find! The girl at the reception desk was very helpful, and explained everything we needed to know about our stay! The rooms, a triple and a double, were very clean and spacious, with even the single bed in the triple room having plenty of privacy and space. Admittedly, the walk to the double room, on the 3rd floor, was quite a vertical trek up very narrow twisty stairs, but the room was more than adequate for the stay. Both were en suite, and the shower was powerful. The only down side was one of the night porters, who was very grumpy, but as we didn't need to have too much to do with him everything was fine. The hotel is ideally positioned for the Leidesplein, a short walk away, and also Museumplein, both very close. The rooms were cleaned everyday, and towels changed. All in all, for the cost of the rooms, I wouldn't expect anything more than we got, and we certainly didn't have any of the problems the other contributors found. Also, another top tip, find Easy Times for a really cool coffee shop to start or finish your evening, as it is the closest to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: purplemushroom39
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 15/02/12-18/02/12. I cannot fault it at all. When me and my freinds arrived we were informed we had an upgrade to standard rooms at not extra charge. Great start! The room was also ready a lot earlier than expected and we were allowed to go straight up. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again. I booked this hotel as a 'budget' hotel and it ticked all of the boxes for us. I can say, having seen some of the other 'budget' hotels in the town this is a far superior one in that range. It was clean bright and airy......if you want 4* luxury then you need to book into a hotel that caters for that. If you want a great budget hotel then this is the best place I have found in Amsterdam apart from the sister hotel of The Quentin Arrive, which is closer to the Red Light District. Would always be more than happy to stay at either.

Reviews.Title: “Good for location”
Reviews.Author: jammiedodgerScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5th Jan - 8th Jan, Down a very quiet street-handy for everything-out on main you have the casino, pubs, hard rock cafe, blue boat bus and vondelpark all with in distance. Just a little walk to the muiesumplein-get a taxi to anne frank-I had blisters for days. Just up a bit on main you have all the pubs/clubs-Jimmy Woos was great. At the most room was ok for stay-yes u can hear everything-stayed in room 203-be warned if staying during week-and you want a lie in-kids nursery out back and u can hear them screaming while out playing, lol all in all a good trip and room was fine-room was hoovered and cleaned everyday with clean towels

Reviews.Title: “THE TRUTH”
Reviews.Author: Daniel L
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival..... sheer disappointment, even the shabby outside sign couldnt prepare us for what was ahead. However upon entry we were plesantly surprised with the rustique tables, wooden floors and general ambiance. We arrived a few hours before checking and so wanted to sore our suitcases. After being issued with the fence post key, my friend kindly took my suitase (being a fine blonde) down the stairs of death and into the dungeon basement, ignoring the suspicious smells. Having stored our luggage we went out to enjoy the pleasures of the city. We returned to check in and were informed that although we had booked two rooms together we were in fact not going to be neighbours. I was condemmed to the top floor of the left hand side of receiption and my friends the right. Im no bear grylls, but even my friend who's a fireman was out of breath climbing the stairs to hell. Why didnt i take the lift you ask- because they dont have one. Oh and the floors arent linked so to visit my friends room i had to walk all the way down and all the way up again. May i recommend this place as a low class fat camp. Having reached the summit we opended the gateway to hell! It soon became apparent there was more DNA in these rooms than the brothels in Amsterdam! Mine came with an interesting patch, i think they must have moved the body a few hours before. I honestly dont know what it was but im sure it hand life in in. My friend saw the upside, 'oh at least youve got a nice big wardrobe' he said. He couldnt have be more wrong... the wardrobe was the bathroom/wetroom/beeding ground for lime disease.. Distraught my friend departed to discover the likes of his room. The only luxuary was the two inch window. It opened but not enought to abort the flithly smell of the DNA in the room. Safety is clearly very important here. My fireman friend soon noticed that a large stripy sock had been placed over the only fire/smoke detection in the room. Stay here at your own peril. We hired bikes, we went out, partied and enjoyed the city spending nd much time away from armageddon as we could. Our good mood was quickly squashed as soon as we returned to the hotel.We had to shower in the dark as the bulb went, got eletrocuted by the light switch and were constantly examining the red bites over out bodies. Concerns for our health growing by the hour we finally escaped but not unscathed. We are still discusing the whole experience one month later and are all still very much emotionally affected. To summerise- If you havent packed your sense of humor, forensic suit and mountaineering equipment, you may not survive to type a review on here

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfectly placed hotel with friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lucylujane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of December. We were upgraded to a better room on arrival. Room was very spacious. Hotel wad very close to Leidseplein and within walking distance of Vondel Park. Have stayed in this hotel before and would definately stay again. Much better value than the Quentin Hotel in the Leidseplein

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel room EVER!”
Reviews.Author: SpanishGulliver
Reviews.Content: 1st, the positive: walking distance from everything. Quiet & safe neighbourhood. Great service at Reception (i.e. a girl from N.Y. who was very helpful with tourist info & breakfast). Breakfast was appropriate for the price. 2nd: NOT so positive: we got room 22. If you get this room, run like hell or demand a different one: NOT 1 single window, not even a ventilation vent in the bathroom. The room is right next to reception, the stairs, and the breakfast area, getting all the possible noise, screaming, etc.. At 4:30 am, someone decided to sing a whole song, to the top of his lungs, and no one in recption seem to see it fit to stop him. In a minor note, the TV in the room was missing all but one of the buttons. To make things better the light switch for the room tripped throughout the night (apparently it happened in several rooms) and we were left in pitch black to find the door, or the bathroom (as there was no source of light whatsoever: no windows). The single beds were tiny, and wobbly, making them unconfortable to sleep in. In general, location & customer service are the only redeeming features of a horrible sleeping experience. Thankfully we were only staying 1 night. I can assure you I'll be back to Amasterdam, but I can also guarantee it will be to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING! STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: CheapAssTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to spending a long weekend in Amsterdam with my Fiance, and I would say this place ruined the weekend. First of all I stayed in an "economy" room as I usually do when traveling, I was not expecting anything more than a simple bathroom and enough room to sleep. Upon arrival we were put in a tiny room in the musty basement, no big deal I've slept in worse places and I was there to see the city anyway not the hotel. After spending a nice evening in the city, we returned to our room to sleep. Right away my Fiance noticed stains on the sheets resembling "bodily fluids". After entering the bathroom I was overcome with a putrid smell coming from what appeared to be a pump to pump toilet and shower waste out of the basement. It was late so we slept on top of the blankets using our extra clothes to keep warm. Needless to say the next morning we decided to check out, and the hotel charged me for 2 nights stay which I had originally planned on. After talking with the manager the 1st time she had informed me that she would not give me a refund for the night I DID NOT even stay. but she would look into it and call me back. I was more than happy to pay for the night I stayed but didn't feel it was fair to be charged for the second night even though I left early due to the dismal conditions of this hotel. After not receiving a call-back I decided to give the manager a ring back and she told me "you booked a budget room, you are obviously poor and are lying just to get your money back". Needless to say I was appalled as I had never been treated this way, after all I was not trying to get money back for the night I had stayed, just for the night I hadn't. Needless to say I would not return if it was the last hotel on earth. I have been traveling for years and have stayed at many dozens of hotels, this has been the worst hotel experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant staff, good location, but noisy groundfloor room”
Reviews.Author: MelanieBmelaine
Reviews.Content: The reception staff was very pleasant and helpful and would be a definite reason to return to this hotel, however I felt let down by the room cleanliness( dirty carpets and dust piled up on the edges of it, water stains in the ceiling) and a very very noisy housekeeping storage cupboard directly next to the room. You could literally hear everything, even the maid tearing apart the bin bags. Far too noisy to have a nice quiet morning and I suppose the rooms aren;t very sound proof in general. If you stay at this hotel do not get a Ground floor room, you will be disturbed. the other thing, which is a minor, there wasn't a remote for the TV, so bedtime telly ended up in one person having to get up to switch it off.

Reviews.Title: “Only just worth the cheap price”
Reviews.Author: stu c
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights 25 26th September 2011 staying with 8 pals for a 40th birthday. Hotel staff really nice and helpful. Decent location and thats as good as it gets - please avoid room 408!! its on the 4th floor and is only 8ft x 8ft with no windows and its a twin!!! VERY claustrophobic. 2nd night we swapped with freinds to room 109 which was acceptable. Back staircase nothing short of dangerous (so impressive we took pics!) Breakfast poor - rooms dirty - bogies on the walls etc... Would stay again but not with the wife..... Stuart (U|K)

Reviews.Title: “fair price for budget room, good location”
Reviews.Author: bonnierdh
Reviews.Content: we arrived in Amsterdam with no reservation hoping to find a reasonable rate for a decent budget room for one night, but were prepared to return to Germany if we couldn't find one. It was a spur of the moment decision to visit Amsterdam. We were given the name of this property by a different Quentin hotel whose clerk said all of Amsterdam was booked ( we had walked into several hotels) but she said this one might have a budget room available. We walked over as it was nearby and were shown the room which was at the front overlooking the street. It was very simple, and tiny, but clean and on a quiet street and very well located. Really, if you think about it, all one does in a hotel is go to sleep and wash up as you leave for breakfast and don't return, usually, till after dinner. While we are a young senior couple, this hotel would probably be better suited to younger folks or seniors who just want a basic room. If you want extra amenities and decor and ambience, the England isn't for you. If I remember correctly, soap wasn't provided but I'd packed a small hotel bar I had for just such a possibility anywhere we went. The bathroom was clean too. Again, tiny and minimalist but all that is needed is a toilet, sink and shower. The price was very fair, around 80 Euros I think. This in August in the height of tourist season. And Amsterdam was just packed with tourists, a zoo actually. So no surprise everything in budget range was booked. We had a room only one floor up and had no problems with the stairs, even my husband whose knees don't like stairs. Bed and pillows were great. Not too soft, not too hard. We didn't buy the breakfast as the desk clerk told us off the record that for about 1 E more than what is charged by the hotel we could get a more authentic Dutch breakfast around the Leidesplein or elsewhere. We would stay here again if we visited Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, rip off.”
Reviews.Author: skinofstars
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were told that we were going to have to pay significantly more than we were originally booked for as they'd double booked the cheaper room we were supposed to be staying in!! This was all done under the 'service with a sneer' approach to customer care. Of course, we argued the point and the guy on the desk let us of â‚¬10. However, when we checked out another desk guy demanded we pay that â‚¬10 before we left, saying the other was wrong to let us off. Mix all that with what was a pretty scummy room and you're left with a couple of very unhappy customers.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean, and in a good location”
Reviews.Author: J K
Reviews.Content: I really like Quentin England, Iâ€™ve stayed 3 times, and would do so again. Iâ€™m a regular visitor to Amsterdam, and this is far and away my favourite base in the city. A few points: 1) Location â€“ superb. Situated between the lively Leiseplein and the tranquil Museumplein, QE is well-located for easy access to all of Amsterdamâ€™s major attractions, but enjoys a peaceful setting in a quiet side-street. Approximate walking distances: Vondelpark = 1 minute Leidseplein (cafes, bars & restaurants) = 90 seconds Van Gogh Museum (& Museumplein) = 3 minutes Singel = 5 minutes Annfrankhuis = 10 minutes De Wallen (Red Light District), Dam Square & Centraal Station = 10-15 minutes â€¦Personally I prefer to explore Amsterdam entirely on foot, even for lengthier distances, but the QE also enjoys very close proximity to the canal and tram lines of the Leidseplein. 2) Rooms = basic, but clean. For all 3 of my stays, I have stayed in the same room (this was accidental!), which is a double ensuite situated on the ground floor. The room was spacious for its price (never more than around Â£40 per night, sometimes a little less), with a compact but full-equipped toilet/shower room, a double bed, 2 chairs, desk and TV. The rooms are cleaned daily. The only negative points I can think of is that it can be a little noisy at times (this doesnâ€™t bother me), and during one stay, the radiator was cranked up full blast, yet the heat control dial was broken so I couldnâ€™t turn it down â€“ this was a little uncomfortable, even during the blistering cold of early February 2009, but it has only happened once. 3) Hotel facilities = somewhat limited. Wi-fi was extremely temperamental, and access appeared to be turned off for most of the time. This wasnâ€™t much of an issue, though, as itâ€™s definitely more of a vacationers hotel than a business hub! You can get a half decent cup of coffee at reception for 1.50Eur, which by Amsterdam standards is really cheap. There is an abundance of free maps and city guides available for guests to pick up. Hotel staff are not overly-friendly, but again not a real concernâ€¦we had a minor issue with our room key card malfunctioning during one stay, but this was sorted out quickly. Hotel staff are multi-lingual with impeccable English and if you NEED them (which hopefully you wonâ€™t), Iâ€™m confident that theyâ€™ll be helpful and courteous. All in all, the QE offers clean, equipped and highly affordable accommodation in an excellent location to explore this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, good location.”
Reviews.Author: samberly
Reviews.Content: Great location for us just across the road from the park and a sort walk to the museums. The room was clean, average size with a little balcony and the bathroom was basic but perfect for us, only problem was that water spilled out from the shower onto the bathroom floor so we had to sue a towel to soak up the water. The staff were OK, a big thank you to the gentleman with he long hair who helped us open a bottle of wine with out a corkscrew! I can't comment on the breakfast as we woke up too late every morning but the beds were comfortable enough for us to have long long lie ins the only problem was that the walls are quite thin. Over all a nice stay and would probably return.

Reviews.Title: “The booked room was underground, but I was not informed about that”
Reviews.Author: gpflugWien
Reviews.Content: The hotel books people in small underground rooms with no daylight. The customers should be informed about that when they book!! I saw the room and decided immediately not to take it. However they charge me the first night, although it was their fault not to inform me about the details of this "room". Hands-off this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Santorinibride12
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, sinple, tidy and ideally positioned for exploring the city. Yes the stairs are steep but many of the buildings in the city are tall and narrow so nothing we didn't expect. The Quentin is very close to the tram stops, shops and restaurants and very good value compared with others in the area. If we do ever return to the city we would have no hesitation in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel”
Reviews.Author: benjixx08
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! On checking into the hotel and shown to what can only be describled as a run down prison cell we found blood smudges over the walls next to the bed. The "uprgraded room" had a bathroom the size of a Â£2 coin, with unlimited cracks in the sink. Also the complementray damp stains on the ceiling and wall along the paint peeeling away from every surface was a delightfu; taouch! (please note the sarcasim). The staff with the exception of walter were extrrmly vile and unhelpful. The whole experience isnt fit of a POW camp. The was also the delightful omplimentry breakfast of cockroaches running around the bedroom!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Basic. Great on a tight budget.”
Reviews.Author: 00karnage
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here, luckily we did not take suitcases as the stairs in this establishment were something else! We were on the top floor and the room was nice enough; a quality equal to the price. The staff weren't particularly friendly but we had no problems. Breakfast buffet was ample. The location is a huge selling point for this hotel, in close proximity to many of Amsterdam's attractions. As we spent most of our time exploring and cramming in as many sights as possible this hotel served us well.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and nasty - Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: licketylips
Reviews.Content: Absolutely terrible... We paid 75 Euro for a tiny room in the basement with no windows and no ventilation at all - Not good at all on a hot night. It felt like we were in a dungeon, I wouldn't even let my dog sleep there. We were given a small fan which was so loud we couldn't sleep at all with it on. We asked for an upgrade however they wanted to charge us another 30 Euro for a room not much better. We ended up finding a much larger room in another hotel in the middle of the city for the same price, and still charged us two nights for cancelling - as we just wanted to leave I couldn't have been bothered to argue with the management any longer to keep my money.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: KarineDav
Reviews.Content: We reserve our room at the last minute but we had a good surprise. The location is great, close to the museum district close to Vondelpark, not far at all from the center and the neighborhood is very calm. The room was not big but not too small either and it was clean. The service was welcoming. Overall it was a nice in this great city and I'll recommand this hotel to others for a nice hotel not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “couldnt be worse”
Reviews.Author: 186338Anita
Reviews.Content: We lived on the 4th floor of the building. Although we got little suitcases, but bring it up was a nightmare. So if u traveling with slightly large suicases, do not choose here. Apart from the stairs, the room was disappointting. we paid 110+ euro per nite, but the room is smallest room i have ever stay. There even have no desk and only 1 chair for a double room. When we sae the room, we were speachless and we decided to find another hotel immediately. Internet service was never working during our stay, the staff even told us to go to Mcdonaled or other quentin hotel! can you bbelieve this? what is more, they dont even have hair dyer in the room!! meaning we have to walked 5 floor of stairs to go down and borrow the air dyer when we need it. oh! u even need to pay the deposit! this hotel shouldnt be calling themselve as a 'hotel' more like a HOSTEL!!!! or youth hotel or deserve no stars at all

Reviews.Title: “Wost Ever”
Reviews.Content: the wors iv ever been in i got curr=esd out in front of my children by the manager also the room was terrrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great basic hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tina1127
Reviews.Content: Of course the quentin england isnt all bells and whistles, it is a basic city centre hotel. The rooms are a decent size with everything you could need, after all on a city break you barely use your room at all. The rooms were clean and tidy and had its own shower room - no bathroom sharing. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The walls are a little thin so you can hear the other guests walking around but overall i would stay here again. Good clean acommodation for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “An airless sweaty sauna”
Reviews.Author: Xanthis
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by pointing out that I do travel cheaply and am well familiar with cheap hostels all over the world and generally know what to expect and accept that, this place however is an extreme. As lovely as the hotel is from the outside and the location next to Vondelpark and tramlines exemplary words can barely describe the room I got. The rom felt like a very tiny, sweaty airing cupboard! The size I could have dealt with had it not been for the fact that there was no ventilation nor window so I literally had to get up repeatedly during the night to wave my door and get some air in!! Not something me as a lone travelling female would normally consider doing, especially given the partying nature of my neighbours. The size of the room was about the same as a proper bed, into which were crammed a small cuboard, tiny table, a television and a short, thin bed but at least it was ensuite which I thorough appreciated as I went and took cold showers during the night. The non functional tv looked menacing as it balanced on a flimsy shelve with the open/exposed wires dangling over the bed. So beware the lack of oxigen, oh and yes you have to argue to get a towel ;-) Akward when you relalise this after taking a shower ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly clean, decent value, but yes, the walls are thin.”
Reviews.Author: hfb220
Reviews.Content: I don't know why people are moaning about the cleanliness of this place. For a European budget hotel, it was positively sparkling. Particularly the bathroom. The location is great, it's on a very attractive but quiet street right between Leidselplein and Vondelpark. I couldn't find a better rate anywhere else, so I'm pretty satisfied. They also tolerate smoking in the rooms, FYI, as long as you keep the window open. My only complaint is that on the Friday night, I was awakened quite a few times by people tromping in. The walls are pretty thin. But the rest of the time it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money - basic but expected for price! Lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: LauraMsouthend
Reviews.Content: Whilst I understand the anger of some people on this review page, the Quentin England hotel gives exactly what you should expect for your money - which is basic but enough. For couples on a romantic trip, I would suggest but definitly for a few days with friends or relatives. Yes the stairs are steep but this is Dam baby, deal with it!!! Ive been to Dam 8 times in the last 3 years - stayed twice at Quentin England (very good), once at the Quentin hotel (very good) and 5 times at the Quentin Arrive (not great to be honest) and each time service and facilites were basic but enough. I slept well, was looked after when very bad weather flooded my room, and upgraded when they were quiet and had the room free! If you want South of Amsterdam town but still near loads of night life and pubs, go Quentin or Quentin England. These are 5 minutes away from all you need and 15 min from red light district and 20 / 25min walk from station. I prefer these two - and the polish staff are lovely. If you want to stay near station and 10 min from red light, then stay at Arrive but be warned, this one has not had a makeover and is the most basic of the lot - expect dusty carpets and no free towel - but each of the hotels has quite a soft bed and big pillow and tv.

Reviews.Title: “Average, could do better”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerX9
Reviews.Content: There are quite a few hotels near by in similar buildings, i am quite sure it is not gong to be very different when it comes to very steep narrow stairs and thin walls. We had luggage and had to climb up to the third floor. Backbreaking, gravity defying experience.So i would not recommend this place or anything similar to people packed up for couple of weeks.Rooms are not spacious. Location is pretty nice, not at center but a very calm nice seconds to Vondelpark, Tram lanes, stores, hard rock cafe, comedy club are 5-10 minutes walking distance. Even though far from city center, walking back to this hotel late night was not a problem since main roads where well guarded by local police. Staff could be more friendly... oh.. there is nothing much 'english' about this hotel.Just the name i guess!

Reviews.Title: “absolute rubbish”
Reviews.Author: tourguidebarbie69
Reviews.Content: We arrived at what we thought was the hotel we booked- Quentin Hotel. The staff there were so rude and told us we were not staying her and had been moved to the Quentin England Hotel, wothout any justification or help with transfers. We arrived at the Quentin England Hotel. The receptionist was so smary and arrogant and thought the whole thing was very amusing, which it wasn't for us! The room was tiny and so hot. The shower was disgusting and they did not provide towels for guests! The beds were really uncomfortable and the sheets felt like sandpaper. Amsetrdam is amazing byt steer clear of thisshorrible hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I did not know that you could get a room without a window”
Reviews.Author: sanieczka
Reviews.Content: I was quite astonished to find that my hotel room did not have a window. It had a bathroom though. Ventilation system worked. The hotel was not dirty. The staff was ok, except the polish receptionist that was plainly rude. On may first night some Brits (that were staying at the hotel) made sleeping impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty and with a lot of insects....even a mouse”
Reviews.Author: belatrix7
Reviews.Content: I did realise when I selected this hotel that it could be so dirty. The floor from my room was never cleaned. I had insects in my room, and one night the visit of a mouse. If you want to enjoy Amsterdam don't choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty w/Incompetent Staff, but Close to Main Square”
Reviews.Author: Seeker707
Reviews.Content: Let me say the good things before I get into what was wrong with the place. The location was good. Some of the staff were friendly (the manager and a couple of the guys who were at the desk overnight). The bad. We stayed at a room in the basement of the â€œhotelâ€�, which is really more of a hostel. It was so hot I couldnâ€™t sleep and it took almost 24 hours to get a fan. The window was broken so that it stayed OPEN and we had to explain to them that this was unsafe and they had to fix it. The guy came down and looked at it and said: â€˜We donâ€™t have a key for the lockâ€� (which was broken anyway). Although he eventually put a screw into the wall so the window could only be opened a few inches, it took a while to make he and the (extremely unintelligent) girl at the front desk to understand why it was a problem at all. Next. The room was dirty. They claimed to clean it every day, but I KNOW they didnâ€™t sweep the floor and there was black dirt everywhere. The room itself looked kind of like a dingy crack-head suite from a low-budget depressing we-want-to-make-you-hate-life sort of movie. The bathroom didnâ€™t have soap (it was out and never got replaced) and the shower is separated from the toilet by a flimsy curtain. One good part about the shower: it didnâ€™t have a problem draining since there was a large hole in the tile next to the drain! How convenient. Finally, when we asked for the manager to call us a cab, he started talking to another guest and about 10 minutes later noticed we were still sitting in the lobby. â€œOh, did you want me to call you a cab?â€� he asked. Um, no I just said that for fun. Yes, of course I want you to call me a cab, thanks. He did and we got to the train station in a timely manner. Conclusion: dirty, dark, hot, dingy, unintelligent staff. Value for the money? I donâ€™t think so.

Reviews.Title: “stinky pigeon hole”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdvis0r
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location, just a few steps really from Vondelpark and Leidseplein if this is the area you wanna visit. Remember it is not that close to Red Light etc. if this is what you are looking for (about 30 min. walk or couple of stops with a tram) Hotel looks bed from the outside, the building is not taken care of properly, room we got was a joke for almost â‚¬100.00 a nite, there was only 1 bed and a tiny bathroom. Terrible and claustophobic!!! Staff stoned I guess with huge black circles around eyes tried to be kind but it wouldn't really help. They had no idea where Vondelpark was, although it was 50m away at the end of the street. Please do not stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: unconquered_mind
Reviews.Content: These comments really make me laugh, i cant believe how much people moan! IF YOU BOOK A BUDGET HOTEL, EXPECT BUDGET SERVICE! Grrrrrr! If i go away for work or on holiday and want a comfatable long term stay i wont book a hotel like this! Id pay 3 times as much for much better service if thats what I was after. However me and my brother have just got back from a 3-day drinking/cultural holiday in Amsterdam and for the 40euros each we paid i thought the hotel was fine. Ok, lets get down to business.. Bad points; The general decor of the hotel is very shabby, it's not been painted or decorated in years. No bar, the only refreshments available are a very limited range of canned soft drinks from behind reception. There was a small hole in the window of around 2 inches wide. No soaps or toileteries (apart from toilet paper). No towels provided (see below). The two single beds were tiny and uncomfatable with 'rubbish' pillows and bed covers. The hotel is noisy, you can hear people upstairs, next door or whenever people are walking up and down the stairs (quite loud). The stairs are very steep and hard to walk up. AND THE GOOD POINTS; Excellent location, only a couple of minutes walk from the shops and bars. I found the staff were genarally polite and helpful.. i've had ruder at the Hilton. Towells were provided when requested. Not 'clean' but clean enough for a couple of days. Despite the noise this was due to the structure of the hotel and despite the number of young people in the hotel i didnt come across any 'rowdy' people. The thing for people to remember is this is a really cheap hotel in a really expensive city. I wouldnt want to spend a week or more here but id be quite happy to stay for cheap short breaks. It depends what your after. Even though we could both afford the Hilton we were even considering staying in a hostel as all we were using it for was sleeping. This hotel is fine. I wouldnt want to honeymoon in it (LOL). Moaning snobs should stop slagging it off, stop trying to be cheapskates, and spend some money to stay in a 'proper' hotel if they dont like it. Chow.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: rjhome11
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel several years ago, I knew that the facilities that although rather spartan, woul suit our requirements. However on this trip it extended to the non-provision of basic hotel supplments such as soap & towels. When we first requested some soap for the room, we were told to our astonishment by the receptionist & I quote, "We don't provide soap". This took us rather by surprise & rendered us more in a dazed state of incredulity that anything an Amsterdam coffee shop could provide. Also no towels were provided until we requested them, the TV remote required a â‚¬20.00 deposit to enable use of the TV (this info was not supplied prior to our trip), and the window & main light switch were in states of disrepair. Furthermore, we were also surprised that payment by debit cards would incur a 5% surcharge - again I'm sure that this info was not provided beforehand.. I will not make the mistake of staying at this hotel again should I return to Amsterdam - I'm sure there are many better options that to receive the treatment we received on this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Unreliable airport Shuttle and Dirty Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: valentinoEngland
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel we were guided to a room containing a bed, wardrobe, two glasses and two towels. Sheets were soiled, dead flies llittered the walls and the HEATING was on full blast, it literallty sweltered us out of the room. Staff delivered the bare minimum in customer service and on the final day we asked the gentleman on the reception to order us the Airport shuttle bus from the neighbouring Marriott Hotel. He confirmed he had booked it and after waiting for over an hour, it turned out he had done no such thing. The helpful staff t the Marriott then ACTUALLY ordered the bus for us and luckily we caught our flight home. Will not be going there again, best thing about it was the location, only a few tram stops from the centre of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Like living in a shoe box”
Reviews.Author: EivindO
Reviews.Content: A 2 x 2 m2 room, and a tiny bathroom, thats what you get at Quentin England. Did I mention no windows? Like beeing stuck in a tiny elevator. But, It was clean, and the bed was not so bad. The staff was polite and helpful. It was on the other hand a rather noisy experience, as the walls were paper tin. It is bether than a youth-hostel, and you get privacy, even though the rooms are smal. The location is good.

Reviews.Title: “You find better hotels...”
Reviews.Author: Norway30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly okay for young people who are in Amsterdam to party and drink. For elderly people, romantic couples and families: Stay away! So hereby you are warned! Positive: Quite helpfull staff, some rooms are okay standard, quite cheap, great location close to Leidseplain party area. Negative: Many rooms are way too small, it`s almost hillarious! Our friends got a room that could easily been in John Cleese`s Fawlty Towers! Our room was okay. But very filthy carpet and curtains. The bathroom was too small, the shower was not function good, the lights was out and there was some constuction work outside the hotel that kept a terrible noise level during Monday-Friday daytime. There was arguing and loud discussions between unsatesfied customers, and those in the reception several times we passed. Not a good sign... In other words: Pay a bit more and you will find way better hotels in Amsterdam. This is not worth your hard-earned-cash.

Reviews.Title: “Don't care Quentin”
Reviews.Author: mushroom4
Reviews.Content: The fact that you book a budget hotel does not give the owners the right to take your money and provide dirty unkempt accomodation to guests. A air of neglect is the general theme of the hotel (apart from the reception area). The bench outside had a completely broken seat and dead conifer sat alongside it. Our room was a triple, second floor. Bathroom clean but broken shower head. Carpet stained and dirty, walls dirty scuff marks on them, all paintwork badly chipped ,window frame rotten and would not close properly on second floor so what horrified me was a child could fall out of the window. Glass shade from wall light was lying on the floor with a jagged edge, again someone could have badly cut themselves on it, reception staff did not seem bothered at all when I pointed this out. A lovely array of cobwebs were hanging from the light ceiling fitting and exposed wires on wall sockets. A new one on me despite having travelled extensively was asking for 20 euros deposit for the remote control.... how petty can you get. Staff ranged from very pleasant and helpful to hostile and rude. No mention on any website about the building work taking place next door, a real treat been woken at 7.30 by drilling when we were still up at 4.00 waiting for the group of men above us deciding when they were going to shut up and allow everyone to sleep. The most annoying thing was that time care and a little effort could have made all the difference to the hotel, nobody seemed to care.

Reviews.Title: “Worst 2 nights of my life”
Reviews.Author: NZKiwiGirl
Reviews.Content: Booked weeks in advance to stay in "Quentin Arrive Hotel"as it was close to the train station, but the day before we were supposed to go to Amsterdam they sent me an e-mail saying that hotel was being renovated and they had transferred us to the "Quentin Engeland" so if I hadn't checked my e-mails the night before, we would have arrived at the wrong hotel - they had my phone number but it must cost too much to phone customers?? So we went to "Quentin Engeland" and well lucky us, turns out the renovations were happening there!?! so we had booked a double room online, and they gave us a dungeon! down in the cellar, two single beds that are so light that if you move slightly the mattress slides away from the wall. There was no way to turn on the tv and nobody told us that you had to pay to get the remote control!! Our view from the window was at ground level, a kindof cubby-hole where it looked like a homeless person sleeps, there were a lot of cigarette butts, and outside of the cubby-hole the rubbish bins were such a pretty sight. The window wouldn't lock so we jammed something in it so nobody could get in. It was extremely noisy, people above us mainly. And at 7am the builders started with their noisy drills etc. I reccommend this place to nobody. Not sure about the non-dungeon rooms, they're probably fine! If you stay here, specify that you do not want a cellar room!!

Reviews.Title: “poor service and hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: katoliverpool
Reviews.Content: On arrival, we were greeted by a very rude receptionist who was not willing to provide any level of customer service. When we booked this hotel 2 months ago, there was no mention of a 5% fee for paying for the accommodation and thus were obliged to pay upfront for three day accommodation in cash on a Friday night at 11pm!!! My pal had to pay the credit card fee and was only informed after paying that, there was a cash machine around the block. All in all the hospitality was non-existent as the sheets in the room were only changed once, and the bathroom never cleaned during my stay. I raised a complaint with the manager who then offered a refund of the credit card charge if we settled the full amount in cash and then await a refund on the credit card within the next 10 days!!!!!!!!!!!!!. Overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone, as there are much better hotels nearer to the city centre for the same price as we found in our search for alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Low Budget room was awful”
Reviews.Author: Northernjock
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. Very tiny rooms, paper thin walls and the staff high on dope in middle of night. No towels left, no toilet paper - however room was cleaned every day. Although it was a budget room, i would still have expected more for what we paid, it wasnt that cheap after all. Ideal for a stoner or someone passing through for a night, but would not recommend any longer. Has the smallest window I have ever seen which let in no air at all.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: yaponi
Reviews.Content: Believe me, everything everyone writes about this hotel is true. I chose to go ahead with my stay anyway, and I came face to face with incredibly unfriendly staff, filthy brown pillows, no towels or toilette paper and a tiny window in a 7"x7" room-so tiny that I had a claustrophobia attack. That being said-it does have easy acess to many attractions-so that was a plus. It was also on a nice street, but when you step into the hotel, it's like stepping into a hell hole. I would not stay there again-no way.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jomu61
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel and the experience was not a good one at all. The hotel staff are unhelpful and unfriendly. When we arrived they put us in the "Garden Room" - which is little more than a tool shed outside the back of the hotel. The room was tiny, musty, and did not run on the hotel's water supply, but rather on a noisy pump that turned itself on each time any water was used. We immediately requested another room (I have asthma and could not breathe in this 'room'). We were told there were no other available rooms. We went out and returned later to the room. Again, I could not breathe, so we went back to reception (another person was on the desk) and they initially told us there were no other rooms available. My husband was a bit angry and pointed out that this was nothing more than a tool shed. I added that if they couldn't find us another room they should find us another hotel. Suddenly, they had an available room! This room was much better, but it had no ammenities. The room was not cleaned daily, the walls and carpets were filthy and the television did not work. However, the beds were very comfortable. Again, I stress that the staff were non-responsive to the point of being rude. They made me feel that I was interferring in their job and the receptionist spoke to me only when she was finished on her computer work. I felt like an intruder in this hotel. On the good side, it is in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Unresponsive staff, loud, smoky”
Reviews.Author: TravelChica2012
Reviews.Content: I just spent 8 nights at the Quentin England and was very disappointed. The continental breakfast at the hotel is very sparse and they frequently ran out of food (such as bread) less than halfway through the breakfast time. The front desk staff was rude, cold and unresponsive to problems including leaks and windows that wouldn't close. The hotel is quite smoky and most of the hotel workers smoke in the lobby. The last two nights I was there the group staying next door came back at 3am woke us up by being falling while coming up the stairs, screaming, smoking and carrying on for more than an hour. Room phones rarely work so calling the front desk was not an available option. Staircases are particularly steep and rickety. The luggage storage room flooded while we were there and that staff seemed reluctant to attempt to do anything to remedy the problem. The hotel felt like a youth hostel only for double the price. The Owl Hotel down the street although a bit more expensive would be a much better option.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant "stay"”
Reviews.Author: joliesta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night in July 2007. When I checked in I was in a hurry so I just put my bags on my bed, took a quick shower and ran off to meet a friend. I spent the rest of the day and evening outside and returned to the hotel at around 2 am. Went into my room and noticed some sort of small, black bugs crawling on the walls around my bed and on the bed as well. I am a chicken and freaked out a bit, so I packed my things and left my room in the middle of the night! I was catching a plane at 10:30 am the next morning, so I ended up sitting in the lobby until 4:30 am and then walked to the train station. The bugs were disgusting and the room was small with a strange, unpleasant smell. TV didn't work and the walls were paper thin. I had a single room on the top floor with shared bathroom/shower. I really wish I had chosen another hotel, and I would have liked to stay in another area too. If I had only discovered Tripadvisor before going... I would never ever stay at this hotel again and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really not a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MrBoon
Reviews.Content: Just don't do it. Â£60 a night to stay in someone's loft is way OTT. Our room was pretty 'unclean' with marks and stains on the walls and carpet. We couldn't operate the TV as the hotel had removed the buttons, you have to ask for the remote at reception and leave a 20 Euro deposit - [--]? Our hot tap didn't work at all and the cold one ony periodically, upon bringing this to the attention of the front desk staff I was greeted with non-plussed expressions and was fobbed off with a bottle of cold water! I wouldn't stay here again, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, unless of course they asked me to recommend an over-priced, under-maintained, filthy flea pit in which to spend a few uncomfortable nights. In summary - don't stay here, find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “not happy, not happy at all”
Reviews.Author: Pollocks10
Reviews.Content: We hired two NON budget double rooms and a single and ended up in the loft, via the ladder steps, in twin rooms that are clearly the preserve of dunken stag/hen do's normally. If you don't mind taps that don't work, rooms with no windows and dry vommit on the curtains then this is the place for you. Taking away the buttons off the TV and then wanting 20 euro's deposit for the remote is pushing it a bit though. We were particuarly impressed with the dry blood on the wall of the single room too, nice welcoming touch! The location is its only saving grace, meaning you can escape the noise when you've had enough.... that's it!

Reviews.Title: “Thank God for Quentin England”
Reviews.Author: Ralphie_Milne
Reviews.Content: Without the experience of staying at the 'Quentin' I wouldn't have a clue as to what to expect if I ever had the misfortune to end up in prison. Now I do and I know it's not for me. This hotel has saved me from ever embarking on a life of crime because I couldn't hack doing porridge if it's anything like my stay at the 'Quentin'. Life in the 'Quentin' is tough, very tough, especially if you happen to be booked into one of it's famous basement rooms by an idiotic / masochistic friend who should know better. There is no light, no air, no space, absolutely no security (if you happen to have the room with the vista of the bins), although the hotel can boast a rat infestation and a rather charming jackson pollock-esque homage in room 6 that someone has painted in what appears to be dried blood. 2 of the basement rooms are so oppressively hot it is impossible stay in them for long periods without beginning to look like characters jettisoned from an episode of 'it aint half hot mum'. Strangely like prison you become accustomed to the ways of the 'Quentin' and it starts to grow on you like impetigo (which you stand a good chance of catching whilst on your stay at 'Quentin' just like a pathogenic Brucie Bonus) and you become institutionalised to the point where you become wary of hotels that are safe, clean and have more on the room service menu than a Twix (that's not a joke!). I cannot stress enough how stale this hotel is; if it were a footballer it would be Titus Bramble, if it were a cheese it would be quark, if it were a country it would be Belgium; it is quite possibly the worst hotel in the world...ever!

Reviews.Title: “Had A Nightmare Stay”
Reviews.Author: jade12Birmingham
Reviews.Content: I booked a twin budget room with own toilet and shower, on arrival we checked in and were told our room was probably not one of the best but it did say in the small print it could be in the basement without a window, so the alarm bells started to ring, we went into the room (which to us was only what I can describe as storage room for cleaning equipment), there was no ventilation whatsoever and it smelt very fusty, I suffer from Asthma and straight away could feel my chest tightening, we went back to reception and asked politely to be moved we would be willing to pay more for a better room. We were told there were no rooms available as there was a conference on, but people would be checking out tomorrow and we could then move. After a terrible night sleep we found a note under the door that said sorry we are unable to move you, there are no free rooms. This was very dissapointing to us, as we had come to sightsee but when you get no sleep, you do not feel like doing much the next day. We asked the receptionist again if there was anything, she was helpful and understood out plight she tried to book us in to the central hotel and also found an atic room with a skylight but we had to share facilities, we chose this option because at least we had a window to open and let some air in, the receptionist said we could also have a discount difference between bathroom and no bathroom. On the day of the departure there was a different receptionist and said we would not get any discount, when we told him the other receptionist said we could he rang her and spoke to her and More or less called me liar when she said she could not remember promising me a discount, he would not budge with this and to be honest was patronising, he said we should pay more because we have been moved to a room with a window!!! He said you paid for a low budget room and it does say may not have window and could be in basement, but I would never think that it would not have any ventilation whatsover, surely it was a human right to expect air, we left the hotel very annoyed and frustrated surely that is not a good way to let a customer leave. I told him I had been recommended by a work colleague, i would in a very large organisation, and I would not be recommending this hotel to anyone else and neither will my colleague when I tell her. I cannot believe that as a good will gesture he would not at least give us the difference of the room rates, to be honest it was not the money but the principle. Very dissapointed spolit one day of a three night stay. On a slightly more positive note, it was in a great location, and we looked in other rooms which seemed nice, but please look at small print and personally I would not book a low budget room but if you do state when booking must have a window.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Avoid”
Reviews.Author: dd123Uk
Reviews.Content: Please please do yourself a favour.Do not give this hotel your hard earned money.The rooms are like 1* dormatries & I came away with flea bites too.I have since looked at past reviews and this has been highlighted by other guests.It is not so cheap anyway! plenty of decent 3* rooms in A'dam for 80 Euros.Ps some of the rooms do not have windows either...but they will not tell you that at reception or in fact on the website.Staff were unhelpful & rude & would not change to room with a window without additional payment,even though my booking made no reference to such.For a balanced review I would say hotel is in a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Les666
Reviews.Content: Booking was through a local business friend, I wanted a cheap basic hotel for 2 nights..Frankly it wasnt anywhere near as bad as I thought it would be after reading the reviews.. Ok from the start...Its hard to find and is tucked away in a lovely back road which is very quiet.. I took a cab from the airport and so glad I did, cost was about 42 Euros and it took about 30 mins. If looking at a map of the city its in the bottom left, a good couple of miles to the town centre. Reception staff spoke good English and were very friendly, I travel light and was so glad I did on this occasion.. The rooms on floor 1 and 2 were ok to get to, but the 3rd floor!!! wow I have been up ladders that werent as steep..This is typical of a Dutch house and that is what most of the smaller hotels once were. The room was clean, could do with a coat of paint but no too bad.. A good bed, clean sheets and pillow cases of good quality and the carpet wasnt too bad. Had a private shower and toilet although I thought I might have to share. There was a small TV but it didnt work. And a working telephone. Breakfast was coffee, fresh orange, toast, cheese or ham. On one occasion I went to a local square by the casino and had breakfast at the Irish bar, good omlet etc at good prices.. This is also one of the places you can pick up boat trips around the city. A cab to the town centre was about 12 Euros, but the weather was nice so I walked most days...long way though..and watch for the bikes!!! they seem to come at you from all directions. If visiting for a stag/hen party dont stay here as its miles away from the bars and the red light area. Beer in the city was between 2.5 and 5 Euros depending where you went, in fact the prices for all the local attractions in Holland varied a lot. The Ann Frank house was good to see, again dont go if you cant climb VERY steep stairs.. Cost was 7.5 E per adult. I had 3 days at this hotel, that was enough...If I had taken my wife I don't think she would have liked it much.. It has 2 stars, not sure what for...maybe it was a 1 star....reminded me of a Travel Lodge of old.. If you go here dont expect much and you should be ok, after all you get what you pay for...a nice area is around the Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky.. I wsnt sure what to expect, but as a CHEAP hotel I would give it 3 out of 5...If it was the sort of hotel I usually stay in then only 1 out of 5. I wouldnt stay here again, not because it was that bad but it was just too far away from everything.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: mark60657
Reviews.Content: Book directly on quentin hotels website for the cheapest rates...I think this hotel (or hostel) is probably OK based on what you pay for it in a city like AMS...if you pay any more than 40E, you will be most dissapointed! The rooms are about the size of a large walk in closet, stained carpets, narrow long staircases, rude and ignorant staff, but....great location (near all museums, and Liedesplein)...If you have more than a day to spend in AMS and plan on staying "in" your room for longer than 3-4 hours, look elsewhere...I think this is nothing more than a private hostel with shared restrooms, and it fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel in the world ever”
Reviews.Author: KJPS
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the worst place I have ever stayed. The camp guards at Auschwitz could have taught the receptionist about hospitality. Tiny, tiny rooms with no windows, receptionist laughing at you when she sees the room youâ€™re booked into. Extra 5% charge for paying by credit card. Book a double - you get given a twin - and told if you don't like it you can leave but they will still charge it to the credit card you RESERVED the room with. Avoid this place like the plague, sleep on the street, sleep in central station, man sleep with the hookers but don't, donâ€™t what ever you do, stay at this glorified doss house.

Reviews.Title: “My 'cattery' is better than this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Notelle
Reviews.Content: I was born in Holland and this was my first trip back to the old country. Remembering how fastidiously clean the Dutch people were during my childhood, I got the shock of my life to find that this hotel was not only, not clean - it was absolutely filthy! We arrived late, cold, wet, tired, and hungry from a long international flight to be greeted by one of the most unfriendly female receptionists I have ever met. Even though our room had been booked and paid for in advance, she still demanded a credit card swipe to cover them for any damage we might cause to their room. We then asked her where we could buy a cup of coffee and something to eat. Her answer was, "Not here, maybe 10 or 15 minutes walk down the street". (We later found out from the day staff that you could buy a hot or cold drink and a snack from reception 24 hours a day, but at 11 pm the female receptionist was obviously not in the mood to serve us). To get to our room we had to climb up 2 flights of steep stairs with our heavy luggage (no lift, needless to say). Her only contribution was "Bad luck, this is Amsterdam you know!" Fair enough, but it wasn't the physical problem so much, as the 'attitude' she adopted that riled us. After struggling to get into the room, we found that the beds were not made, there were holes in the walls, the window wouldn't close, the bedlight wasn't working, the telephone wires were hanging out of the wall but there was no telephone, the TV remote control was held together with sticky tape and the bathroom stank of something which made me gag. It was also very noisy as we could hear every sound our 'neighbours' made in their rooms and in the passage ways. Towels were not changed on a regular basis and we had to lock our cases when we left the room after finding out that someone had gone through them on the first day. Breakfast was served downstairs at an extra cost, but it was highly over priced. A tray of crockery & cutlery was 'dumped' on your table after you paid and after that it was a case of help yourself to whatever was left. The variety and quality of the food was poor and the toaster only worked when it felt like it! The breakfast room was very small and often extremely crowded and noisy but the coffee was excellent. Service was non existent. We stayed there for a week and during that time I never saw any of the staff smile once. They all seemed to be unhappy and unfriendly. This hotel and staff doesn't even warrant a 1 star rating in my opinion and the only redeeming factor, is its location. It is situated in a reasonably quiet and seemingly respectable neighbourhood and it was fantastic to be so close to public transport, several museums and "het Leidse Plein" (where most of the action happens)

Reviews.Title: “Managed expectations and I got a Good Price at an Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CraigN
Reviews.Content: Average 2 star hotel. No lift. Quiet street. Relatively clean. Convenient to public transportation (Liedseplein â€“ 3 blocks). Close to museums (Rijkmuseum & Van Gogh). This was my first trip to Amsterdam. From the outside, this hotel looked about on par with others we passed. All looked small (i.e. narrow building with steep steps). Breakfast was continental and adequate as well as adequately supplied (7 euro per person). Paid 70 Euro per night for 2 people (booked through www.easytobook.com.) Room 301 - Shower, sink & toilet were very small & shower was only separated by the shower curtain so the entire floor got wet when the shower ran. Only one person could fit in the bathroom at a time. However, based on the limited space throughout Amsterdam, this may be a routine occurrence. This isnâ€™t meant as a criticism, only an adjustment from what you would expect in a US hotel. There was sufficient water pressure, sufficient hot water, and the water temp didnâ€™t fluctuate dramatically. Leidseplein (3 blocks from hotel) is a public transportation crossroad so easy access to transport all over. Leidseplein also has lots of dining options and an active night life. The Bad: Had to pay full bill at check-in. Housekeeping got the bed half made then stopped and didnâ€™t re-supply towels. (No real problem except it meant an round trip to the lobby.) TV had no volume knob/buttons and to get a remote, there was a 25 Euro deposit (fully refunded). Downside: No elevator. Steep stairs and if you pack heavy, or end up in room 300, itâ€™s not convenient. The last 10 steps between floor 2 and 3 (formerly the attic) is almost a ladder (i.e. very steep). Bathroom (Shower/Sink/Toilet combination) was, shall I say, interesting. Good Value for the money. My hotel selection criteria are 1) safe, 2) clean, 3) convenient then I temper that against price. I would stay again. That said, I would probably elect to stay at a different hotel just to be able to contrast between the two.

Reviews.Title: “OK! Check your room spec in advance if you can!”
Reviews.Author: robferrie
Reviews.Content: We were given a double room on the top floor. Beware, the last few stairs to this area are hazardous - this isn't specific to this hotel, as frequent visitors to Amsterdam will know it's normal in tall buildings for the stairs to be steep. The room itself was clean, but had a wet-room rather than a bathroom. So the floor remains wet after showers... not sure this was made clear when booking but it's ok if you're close to the person you're sharing with I guess. It was really hot, and the window in room 302 is "shared" with the room next door so consequently it is boiling hot. Reception didn't have fans, or a limited number, but seemed not particularly bothered about helping. This isn't wholly true, the young man on reception during the afternoon was far more helpful than the disagreeable young woman who was more concerned about the fact that she didn't have a fan. Customer service doesn't register with this hotel, but for the price you can kind of understand that. In all, I would recommend but make sure that you have facilities in your room. We walked past some single rooms that had the doors open and they looked about as big as a garden shed without windows.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!! Flea and noisy.”
Reviews.Author: azong98
Reviews.Content: Quentin England Hotel - worst hotel! - It has flea and bit me 8 places on my legs. I changed a room, and 2am I found the flea on my sheet! It is not an isolated incident! - It has phone in room, but you can not dial outside. - It has TV, only that it doesn't work. - It has shower, but no lights in there. And every time after you use it, the pipe makes really loud noise. - It has maid service, however, they simplely pour my coffee into face wash sink and leave the brown fluide drying on the white tile. - It has door, only that it does not isolate any noise. If your neighbour makes a turn in his bed, you can hear it! I was waken every 5 to 10 minutes by the slapping door from guests entering into their room, or the front desk people working for night shift doing clean-ups. - It is really hot, regardless having windows or not. Leaving windows open, you can sleep; closing it, too hot to sleep, and still noisy. And funniest thing is, you are prisoned yourselves there because they collect all the cost up front. This is a 2-star hotel. No matter how competitive the rates are, I would expect a standard like 2-star hotel. I comment to the front desk, they should send a staff or investigator to spend a night there and he will know! The female staffs all look grumpy. They obviously hate their jobs. It must be tough working there. The hotel is a crap, so customers are angry. They have to deal with the ugly problems everyday, even changing a room will not help much. I usually check tripAdvisor before booking the hotel, but I was too busy with my work and forgot to check this time, so I made a mistake booking for this one. The location is great. There are many other good hotels on that street: Leids Square hotel, Owl hotel, ... I would highly recommend Leids Square hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For the money, you can't beat the convenience.”
Reviews.Author: bimmerfun
Reviews.Content: I travel to Amsterdam at least once each year, and I've stayed at the Quentin England on 2 occasions. I've stayed at hotels in Amsterdam that were supposed to be 3 and 4 star facilities that turned out to be more like 2 star hotels. I have also rented apartments and houses in Amsterdam which were very nice (beautiful, in fact), but not close to the center of town. Having said that, for the money, I don't think you can do much better than the Quentin England. If you're looking for an inexpensive, clean, quiet hotel near the center of town, your options are limited. I wouldn't want to be stuck in one of the basement rooms at the England during the summer months, but they're acceptable when air conditioning is not needed. I've stayed at better in Amsterdam, and I've stayed at worse, but no place I've stayed at in Amsterdam beats the England's location. It's quiet, but amazingly close to everything, unlike many places that I've stayed at, which are a tram ride (or two) away from everything. I wouldn't want to be stuck in one of the basement rooms during the summer months, but they're acceptable when air conditioning is not needed. I love the excitement of the city, but I like being able to come "home" to a room on a quiet street. I'll be staying at the England on my next trip to Amsterdam in November, because this time around, I want to be near everything. I rented a beautiful house last year, but I spent alot of time on trams getting back and forth! ...It's a trade-off!

Reviews.Title: “Not quiet or spacious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located and is very affordable, so I chose it over many others for a two-night business stay in June. But beware! I stayed in a single room with shower and although the shower/ loo was very nice, the single room is very small (the size of the single bed with extra room only to walk past it on one side) and has *no windows* or ventilation of any kind. I did not sleep at all in this room on a warm night in June. There was nowhere to hang my clothes (one clothes hanger, but the bar to hang it on had been removed), no instructions in the room on what do to in case of fire (and no escape, I later noticed, except for the main staircase to the lobby), and the phone did not work. Also, when you arrive, there is a there is 5% surcharge added to the bill for those paying with a credit card, which is ridiculous. The central staircase is noisy and the walls are very thin. 25E deposit required, I discovered at the desk, for use of television remote control. On my second day I asked to move to a room with a window and was given a single room on the top floor, which had a skylight that opened. Here there was some air and I was able to sleep a bit, but there was still nowhere to hang my clothes, no instructions on how to use anything or to call out (this phone also didn't work) or get out in case of fire. There wasn't even a notice telling you how to call reception. Only one towel in this room (two handtowels and no bath towel in the previous room) and no hairdryer, etc. This hotel was convenient in its location, but my stay here definitely interfered with my work. Recommended only for travellers who want to save money and for whom sleep is not a priority.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience for us”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam, and after reading the poor reviews, my wife and I were expecting a "Fawlty Towers" senario, but seriously we were pleasantly suprised by this so called budget accomodation. We stayed in a 2nd floor double room that was spacious, clean and had a comfy bed, the bathroom was also clean with a good shower and towels were changed daily. As for location, you cannot get too much closer to the Bars & Restaurants of the Liedsepslein (no more than a 3-4 minute walk). This was our 3rd visit to Amsterdam and definately not the worst hotel we have stayed in, all of which were in the area of the beautiful Vondelpark & Liedseplein. The staff were friendly and helpful so in our opinion if you are looking for a budget hotel this is a good choice, give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Dirty, Small,”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be the worst I`ve ever stayed in. Very small, nowhere to hang or put clothes, stairs like ladders, mold on walls, no kettle, no bar, no draws, two hand towels for two large men, dirty tissues under the bed, cold and dusty but then we were upgraded to a basement room, all of the above but with no windows.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews, I'm a bit perplexed. The staff were incredibly helpful (the receptionist let us check in three hours early)! Since my girlfriend and I didn't spend that much time in the room, the value and location was worth the stay. The room was clean, modestly furnished and had a great view. If you don't plan on staying in your hotel room for a prolonged period of time, then I would recommend this hotel. Vondel Park is only two minutes away - a big plus!!

Reviews.Title: “Like a prison cell”
Reviews.Author: Fluffycloud1977
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is its location. Very unfriendly staff, not particularly helpful. They did not make us feel welcome at all. The room was little more than a cell in the basement. The window was tiny, we had to constantly keep the lights on as it was too dark with them off. The wardrobe (if you can call it that) was not big enough for 1 person let alone 2. 2 coat hangers!!! It had a tiny hanging space. We ended up hanging our clothes up around the room. The room was fairly clean on arrival, however, the towels (we got 2) were not changed until we had been in the room for 3 days. We were given 2 toilet rolls and no more. On the positive side, the bathroom was spot on, with a powerful flush toilet and a power shower. Amsterdam itself was FANTASTIC and more than made up for the disappointing accomodation. However, if you can avoid being given the basement rooms, it is an adequate hotel for an adequate price. And as I mentioned, the location is superb. Literally 5 minutes away from the centre, but quiet at night. And the lack of light meant we slept in in the mornings!

Reviews.Title: “Basement room is similiar to Anne Frank's room”
Reviews.Author: chuan
Reviews.Content: If you planned to stay in this hotel, please do not get the room at the basement. It is as small as Anne Frank's room. The bathroom makes lots of noise when switching on the tap.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had read the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Superbly situated close to the Liedesplien square where you can find hundreds of restaurants and bars. The street (Roemmer Visscherstraat) is attractive but surprisingly noisy at night. We were initially given a small, windowless, room in the basement. We asked to be moved on the second day and the friendly and very helpful staff obliged. We ended up in an equally small room above the entrance with a tiny shower room/toilet but we did have a window. The walls were thin, staircase steep and creaky, fairly clean and fine for the budget traveller. Would I stay there again? Hmmmm, possibly look elsewhere I think.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, bad service, expensive.”
Reviews.Author: mnik2006
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Amsterdam (Oct 2005) and here is our experience with The Quentin England Hotel. - On arrival we have been asked to pay in advance our stay. There was the first surprise: if you pay by a credit card, they charge you 5% extra! (no mention on the website, reservation receipt or anywhere else). No debit cards are accepted and if you don't have the cash for the entire stay with you, tough luck. - The lady on the reception (on the day we checked in) was not helpful and on occasions even rude. (If you ever watched the Little Britain show, it is the "computer says no" scenario). - The room and the toilet were not very clean. - The room was small, with very basic equipment, TV was not working well (not that we wanted to use it, but still), the shower is practically non-existent; the pillows are ultra-soft in case this makes a difference to you. - The hotel is extremely noisy, you can hear people talk or walk in other rooms/floors. This becomes a nightmare when you want to sleep as you are constantly awakened by people who pass by or talk. - The hotel is not a good value; the price we paid was very close to the much better Novotel hotel (although the location was not) - The location of Quentin England hotel is good, very close to where restaurants and cafes are.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this one!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The front desk is friendly enough. Paid in advance which I thought was weird as I have not done this before in all of my travels worldwide. That should have been the first clue. Had a single room. Offered one in the first floor. Right off the main hallway, no windows and very small. The other was in the basement (#5). At least had a window with no screen so bugs flew and crawled in. Not much view as it was ground level and the ground below a deck of sorts. Never cleaned the room except to "tidy up" and place new towel. Well the new towel only lasted one day as the help quit right in front of my eyes.
