Had to ask for new towel before I retired for the night. The shower floor floods as the drain works slowly. Fungus Heaven. Very noisy because it was close to the lockers. Just find another place and save yourself a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: nicola_1717
Reviews.Content: Really bad. Listen to other reviewers and stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Use This Hotel-Its Total Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: wigster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rubbish! I have stayed in lots of hotels in Amsterdam over the years & this was by far the worse! I had to pay for room in Advance as soon as i arrived. Then was told there would be a charge for using my credit card! reception looked quite clean though Got to room on 3rd froor, opened door & [--] (sorry to swear but i couldnt beleive it). The room was what i can only describe as a closet. I think it was a store room for mops/cleaning products before being converted to a so called bedroom! THERE WAS NOT EVEN A WINDOW. I DIDNT THINK TO ASK FOR A ROOM WITH A WINDOW IN ADVANCE-SILLY ME!!! Its not much fun not knowing what to wear before leaving your room! There was an "on-suite" which i could barely fit into of about 2ft sq. My towels or bedsheets were NEVER changed during my whole stay! It was like i had been forgotten about & stuffed in a cupboard! My last words will be-NEVER EVER SYAy HERE IF YOU ARE A SINGLE TRAVELLER.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YHosty
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Quentin England Hotel,Amsterdam in June 1998 and June 2002,and to be honest,while it is a small hotel it is very clean and in an ideal location for exploring Amsterdam.While the rooms are abit on the small side,and the stairs up to them are quite steep(this is a feature of alot of Dutch buildings,so I am told by my Dutch brother-in-law),the hotel is a good base for exploring Amsterdam and the hotel is not expensive.Disadvantage of the hotel - staff could be more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “rsole”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this rubbish hotel, not through choice. I had booked at the sister hotel THE QUENTIN with comformation, but arriving at the hotel was told I had no room. I was offered the england hotel instead, I believe they do this all the time as I was imformed by one of their many receptionists. Be WARNED

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: John_from_SF
Reviews.Content: We were booked here for a week but had to check out after only three nights. Rooms are very small...but that wasn't the problem: it was the noise and the smoke. Our room was on the second floor, at the top of the stairs, and we could hear everybody drinking and talking in the lobby until 2 or 3 a.m. each night. Plus, even though the room was "non-smoking" the smoke wafted up from the lobby and right into our room. The people at the front desk were apologetic and nice about the situation, but it didn't solve the problems with the room. With plenty of other places to stay in Amsterdam, we won't be back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Quentin England OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine for those who don't spend a lot of time in it and only use it as a base. Good central location, clean and staff very courteous and helpful. Breakfast is good value - if you like a continental breakfast - at only 7 euros per head, quite competitive. It's stretching it a bit to advertise that the hotel has a bar, all it consists of is a few cans of beer and some miniatures behind the reception desk! Also the walls between rooms are a bit thin and we could hear the TV (and other interesting noises!) from the room next door! But all in all for the price this was fine. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Have stay in beter.”
Reviews.Author: Ney
Reviews.Content: Its in a good area of Amsterdam and just a 10min walk from the main drinking area and the shops but thats about it. Rooms are small. TV in room is ok but dont pick up all channels. Radio in my room had poor signal. Bathroom was ok I guess. Breakfast well never got my breakfast there as there is not enough tables for the rooms and most had to queue for there breakfast if you was late getting up. Best just to take room only as there is planty eating places in the area. My sisters room was worse than mine as she could here people coming in and going in there rooms or going upstairs to there rooms late at night. Staff did try to be very helpful. I only stayed there 3 night in july 2003 but found that was long enough. I have been to Amsterdam before but found this hotel to ber ok if you just staying overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Prisoners live in better conditions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quentin Hotel August '04 and and found the living conditions to be worse that what most 3rd world countries experience. Upon arrival the hotel looked quite well kept on the outside and even in the reception area I thought that the hotel looked ok for a 2 star rated hotel. The chap at reception was ok. He gave directions to my room. I immediately almost smashed my neck on the stairs down to the basement. It would have been easier to walk down them using stilts and having drunk 10 pints of the strongest Dutch beer. I arrived at the 1st room in the basement had had to check that I hadn't actually arrived at a cleaners store room! I opened that door and was greeted with the foisty stench off the brick work within the room and sheer black darkness. I struggled to locate a light switch and could not believe my eyes when I switched the light on. The room was less than 1/2 the size of standard prison cell. The bathroom was filthy and there was a constant sound of what I can only assume to be a boiler 'ticking' over, hour after hour. The single bed was up against a filthy wall nicelyl decorated with squashed insects. For light you are presented with what doesn't even equate to a skylight. There 'window' was approx. a sq. foot in size and opened about 1 inch. No storage space at all for suits, shirts, etc. The window is on the street level and so you can always hear folks passing by at all hours. Worse again are those that sit on the chair outside. My window was immediately under the chair outside and I lost count of the number of times I freaked out at the shuffling of shoes, drunks, etc. Not a good place to stay for those of a nervous disposition. Only way to get over the awful conditions is to drink at least 16 cans of lager from the reception and collpase in a heap somewhere. Little point talking about the food as this was awful too. Room was full of dead spiders, especially around the window area and they only served to block the odd ray of light that managed to squeeze it's way off the street! Lack of towels and had to ask for fresh ones taht seemed as thought they has alreay been used. The worst place I have ever stayed in and would not, under any circumstances recommend staying here or in one of its underground 'war shelters' ever. Sleep on the streets, in a prison cell (more room and far better food) or nearby Vondel Park would be my recommendation here.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stinton1967
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed at this hotel in July 2004 and had booked ot up months in advance. on arrival, 2 of us were told that the only room available was in the basement. This room was worse than a prison cell. no windows, very hot and tiny. we eventually got moved on our 3rd night after being told the hotel was full. The breakfast was appalling. I paid cash, in full for this pleasure only to arrive home and find that they've charged my credit card for 2 nights stay. they won't return my calls, e-mails or letters. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “A No no to Quentin England.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having arrived after a long days work, i was looking forward to my bed. The outside is ok, so not disappointed yet. Walked in and the carpet and walls are looking grubby. Still no worries, as all i want is a clean room and bed. Got to the first room in the basement - filthy, airless. A true sweat box, like in the movies in a 3rd world Country. Had to reject this one. 2nd Room, there was mould on the walls and was so filthy. Reject no. 2 3rd room better than the other 2, but still not liveable. It was 9.30pm. I had no choice and got no sleep. I would recommend bringing a sleeping bag and sleep in the streets rather than this so called hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of a night...”
Reviews.Author: Tertz29
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a group and stayed here during a layover. Though we had reserved the rooms 4 months in advance, they did not have the rooms ready when we arrived at 7 PM. We had to get up early to leave, but most of the group was unable to get a shower as they had no towels for us. The room for me was completely unliveable (beds against the wall on their side and the bathroom was filthy). I was forced to bunk in with a triple in an already crowded room. The staff on duty was very polite, but could do nothing to help the situation, apparently. Find any other hotel and it would probably be better than this one.

HotelInfo.Name: Quentin England Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Roemer Visscherstraat 30, Amsterdam 1054 EZ, The Netherlands
